metadata.title: TensorStax - Data infrastructure that builds itself
metadata.description: Self-healing data pipelines with automated validation, instant testing, and zero guesswork. TensorStax generates structured plans tailored to your infrastructure.
metadata.sitePurpose: AI-powered data infrastructure platform that automates pipeline creation, testing, and deployment
metadata.targetAudience: Data engineers, data teams, modern enterprises managing data infrastructure

visual.subject: Red-orange planet with blue atmospheric edge lighting
visual.visualDescription: Large 3D-rendered planet/sphere with red-orange surface texture and blue atmospheric glow on edges, positioned on left side
visual.observedBehavior: Parallax scroll effect - moves slower than page scroll (approximately 0.6x scroll speed), creating depth illusion. Visible from hero through Section 03
visual.codeHint: gsap.to('.planet-sphere', { y: 100, scrollTrigger: { trigger: '.hero-section', start: 'top top', end: 'bottom top', scrub: 1.5 }})

logoMarquee.subject: Logo marquee with 10 company logos
logoMarquee.visualDescription: Row of technology partner logos: dbt, Airflow, GitHub, GitLab, Spark, Snowflake, Databricks, AWS, Google Cloud, Azure
logoMarquee.observedBehavior: Continuous horizontal scroll from right to left, seamless loop with duplicated content
logoMarquee.codeHint: animation: marquee 17s linear infinite; @keyframes marquee { from { transform: translateX(0); } to { transform: translateX(-50%); }}

sections.heading: Describe what you want. Or pull in tickets
sections.subheading: Start by expressing your intent, whether it's a new dbt model, an Airflow DAG, or a full ETL flow, or pull in tickets from your project tracking tools.

visual.subject: dbt SFDC Account Source Model code snippet
visual.visualDescription: Dark code editor-style box showing SQL code with title 'dbt SFDC Account Source Model', blue chevron icon for execution
visual.observedBehavior: Code box fades in and slides up (translateY: 20px → 0px) as user scrolls into section
visual.technicalImplementation: GSAP ScrollTrigger with opacity + translateY animation
visual.codeHint: gsap.from('.code-snippet', { opacity: 0, y: 20, duration: 0.6, scrollTrigger: { trigger: '.code-snippet', start: 'top 80%' }})

sections.heading: TensorStax plans it
sections.subheading: TensorStax generates a structured plan tailored to your infrastructure, schemas and custom rules you've defined

stepCards.title: Update dim_customer dbt Model
stepCards.subtitle: Finalize and publish the model
details: Add new fields: subscription_tier, mrr_value with proper type casting and null handling
Update model materialization to incremental with unique key='customer_id'

stepCards.title: Create Airflow DAG for dim_customer.sql
stepCards.subtitle: Make a PR for updated DAG
details: Make a PR for updated DAG

animation.subject: Step cards with sequential reveal
animation.visualDescription: Three horizontal cards showing workflow steps with orange numbered badges 'Step 1/2/3'
animation.observedBehavior: Cards fade in sequentially from left to right with stagger animation
animation.technicalImplementation: GSAP stagger animation with opacity + translateY
animation.propertyChanges: Each card: opacity: 0 → 1, translateY: 40px → 0px, stagger: 0.15s delay
animation.codeHint: gsap.from('.step-card', { opacity: 0, y: 40, duration: 0.7, stagger: 0.15, scrollTrigger: { trigger: '.step-cards-container', start: 'top 70%' }})

sections.heading: Pipeline generated in seconds
sections.subheading: Automated data ingestion, transformation, and orchestration using Agent and Airflow

codeComparison.subject: TensorStax-generated vs manual code comparison
codeComparison.visualDescription: Two-column code view showing YAML dbt configuration (left) and Python Airflow DAG code (right)

rightPanel.title: Generated in X%
rightPanel.content: Airflow DAG with BashOperator tasks for dbt run and test

codeComparison.observedBehavior: Code panels fade in and slide up as user scrolls into view. Loading indicator cycles through dots.
codeComparison.technicalImplementation: GSAP fade-in + translateY animation for code panels, CSS animation for loading dots
codeComparison.codeHint: gsap.from('.code-comparison-panel', { opacity: 0, y: 30, duration: 0.7, scrollTrigger: { trigger: '.code-comparison', start: 'top 75%' }})

sections.verificationText: TensorStax verifies all pipelines by dry running them against your data, this ensures you know whether or not the generated pipeline will work in production or not.

sections.heading: All outputs are always verified
sections.subheading: TensorStax verifies all pipelines by dry running them against your data, this ensures you know whether or not the generated pipeline will work in production or not.

validationCards.title: Airflow DAG Dry Run
validationCards.description: In-memory replica of target Snowflake table created.
checkpoints: All steps succeeded in dry run

animation.subject: Validation cards with stagger animation
animation.visualDescription: Two dark cards with colored icons (teal Airflow logo, red X for DBT), bullet lists with green checkmarks
animation.observedBehavior: Cards fade in with stagger delay, then bullet points reveal one-by-one within each card
animation.technicalImplementation: GSAP ScrollTrigger with stagger for cards, then stagger for bullet points
animation.propertyChanges: Cards - opacity: 0 → 1, translateY: 40px → 0px, stagger: 0.15s. Bullets - opacity: 0 → 1, translateX: -20px → 0px, stagger: 0.1s
animation.codeHint: gsap.from('.verification-card', { opacity: 0, y: 40, duration: 0.7, stagger: 0.15 }); gsap.from('.verification-card .bullet-item', { opacity: 0, x: -20, duration: 0.5, stagger: 0.1 })

featureCards.label: (AUTOPHIX + GIT INTEGRATION)
featureCards.title: SELF-HEALING PIPELINES
featureCards.description: Detects issues, suggests fixes, and automatically creates GitHub pull requests to patch failing code and pipelines.

featureCards.label: (AUTO CODE COMPLETION & VALIDATION)
featureCards.title: GENERATE DATA MODELS, TESTS, PIPELINES ON YOUR INFRASTRUCTURE
featureCards.description: Automatically generate tests, assertions, and new dbt models with strong schema typing and performance patterns.

animation.subject: Section heading + feature cards stagger reveal
animation.visualDescription: Two-line heading (orange + white), orange pixelated grid icons on sides, two feature cards below
animation.observedBehavior: Heading lines appear with stagger (0.2s between lines), grid patterns fade in, then cards appear with stagger (0.15s delay)
animation.technicalImplementation: GSAP ScrollTrigger with stagger for text lines and cards
animation.propertyChanges: Heading lines - opacity: 0 → 1, translateY: 30px → 0px, stagger: 0.2s. Grid patterns - opacity: 0 → 1, scale: 0.8 → 1. Cards - opacity: 0 → 1, translateY: 40px → 0px, stagger: 0.15s
animation.codeHint: gsap.from('.section-05-heading-line', { opacity: 0, y: 30, stagger: 0.2 }); gsap.from('.decorative-grid', { opacity: 0, scale: 0.8, duration: 0.5 }); gsap.from('.feature-card', { opacity: 0, y: 40, stagger: 0.15 })

features.title: COMPILER LAYER
features.description: Agent generates missing code blocks, validates syntax and DAG structure, and runs dry-runs to ensure correctness before deployment.

animation.subject: Validation state transition (error → success)
animation.visualDescription: Error state (red X × 2 + <missing>) transforms to success state (red X + green checkmarks + filled values in orange)
animation.observedBehavior: Before/after states shown vertically, suggesting auto-fix animation where Agent fills missing fields
animation.technicalImplementation: GSAP timeline animating icon swap, text color change, content replacement
animation.propertyChanges: icon transform/opacity transition, text color red → orange, content innerHTML replacement
animation.codeHint: gsap.timeline().to('.error-icon', { opacity: 0 }).to('.success-icon', { opacity: 1 }).to('.value', { color: '#FF6635', innerHTML: 'daily at 9am' })

features.title: DATA OS & OVERAVAILTY
features.description: Manage your pipelines across all of your tools in one centralized location.

animation.subject: Section 06 entry with stagger between left/right features
animation.visualDescription: Two feature sections with titles, descriptions, and interface mockups showing validation/error states
animation.observedBehavior: Sections faded in as user scrolled past Section 05 bottom, stagger delay between left/right sections
animation.codeHint: gsap.from('.section-06 .feature', { opacity: 0, y: 40, stagger: 0.15, scrollTrigger: { trigger: '.section-06', start: 'top 70%' }})

steps.label: CONNECT DATA
steps.title: CONNECT YOUR DATA
bullets: Choose your source: Snowflake, PostgreSQL, S3, etc.

codeEditor.content: Complex SELECT query with CTEs, DISTINCT operations, date/time columns

prompts: What is the purpose of business question for the last qr...

animation.subject: Section 07 entry with stagger
animation.observedBehavior: Section faded in with stagger between elements (heading → step 1 → step 2 → step 3 → button → panel)
animation.codeHint: gsap.from('.section-07 > *', { opacity: 0, y: 40, stagger: 0.12, scrollTrigger: { trigger: '.section-07', start: 'top 70%' }})

features.label: NO LIVE INFRA HIT
features.description: incremental model validations run safely in memory

visual.subject: Orange security panel + 3D city visualization with parallax depth
visual.visualDescription: Left panel with bright orange background (#FF6635) containing security heading and descriptive text. Right panel shows dark 3D rendered city scene with tall buildings (skyscrapers with detailed facades), lit windows creating orange/amber glow pattern, street view perspective looking down urban corridor between buildings, atmospheric fog/haze effect in distance
visual.observedBehavior: Panel fades in with translateY (30px→0px) on scroll entry. City scene has subtle parallax depth effect (buildings at different layers move at slightly different speeds during scroll - near buildings faster, far buildings slower). Window lights have subtle glow/bloom effect creating warm ambiance. Camera perspective suggests slight rotation during scroll
visual.technicalImplementation: GSAP ScrollTrigger for panel animation with stagger effect for text and labels. City scene likely Three.js or CSS 3D transforms for multi-layer parallax depth. CSS box-shadow or filter:blur for window glow effect. Possible camera rotation animation tied to scroll progress
visual.propertyChanges: Left panel - opacity: 0→1, translateY: 30px→0px, duration: 0.8s. Feature labels - stagger delay 0.1s between each. City scene - near layer translateZ: 0→-50px, far layer translateZ: 0→-150px, camera rotation: 0→2deg, scrub: 2

visual.subject: Daft Explorer UI screenshot
visual.description: Dark terminal with file tree, SQL REPL tab showing 'schema_snapshot' table with 8 columns: id/run_id/data_date/schema_json/valid_from/valid_to/created_at/updated_at, data rows with red error indicators

visual.subject: Flow diagram
visual.description: Flow diagram showing connected nodes (file tree on left, multiple colored boxes with labels and connecting lines on right)

animation.subject: Heading + feature cards stagger reveal
animation.visualDescription: White 'Built for modern' + orange 'data teams', two feature cards below
animation.observedBehavior: Split-text heading animation, cards slide up with stagger (0.2s delay)

sections.text: AUTOMATED VALIDATION, INSTANT TESTING, ZERO GUESSWORK.

animation.subject: Brown validation section entry with text reveal
animation.visualDescription: Dark brown/copper gradient background section with white uppercase text centered
animation.observedBehavior: Section slides up into view (translateY: 100px→0px). Text fades in with character-by-character reveal effect (typewriter style) or word-by-word stagger (0.05s between words). Background has subtle gradient shift animation (copper to brown back to copper, 3s cycle)
animation.technicalImplementation: GSAP ScrollTrigger for section slide-up, SplitType for text reveal, CSS gradient animation or GSAP for background color shift
animation.propertyChanges: Section - opacity: 0→1, translateY: 100px→0px, duration: 0.8s. Text words - opacity: 0→1, stagger: 0.05s, duration: 0.4s per word. Background gradient - color shift with 3s ease-in-out loop
animation.codeHint: gsap.from('.validation-section', { opacity: 0, y: 100, duration: 0.8 }); const text = new SplitType('.validation-text', { types: 'words' }); gsap.from(text.words, { opacity: 0, stagger: 0.05, duration: 0.4 }); gsap.to('.validation-section', { background: 'linear-gradient(90deg, #8B5A3C 0%, #A67C52 50%, #8B5A3C 100%)', duration: 3, repeat: -1, yoyo: true })

background.subject: Mars landscape CTA section with parallax
background.visualDescription: Dramatic Mars-like desert landscape with orange-brown terrain, scattered rocky formations creating silhouettes, distant mountain range on horizon, atmospheric haze/dust creating depth
background.gradient: dark brown #4A3428 at top to lighter orange-brown #8B5A3C at horizon

badge.text: AUTOMATED VALIDATION, INSTANT TESTING, ZERO GUESSWORK.

animation.subject: Mars landscape CTA section with parallax + text reveal
animation.observedBehavior: Background image has slow parallax scroll effect (moves 30% slower than scroll speed, creating depth illusion). Heading fades in and slides from left (translateX: -50px→0px). Subheading follows with 0.2s delay, also sliding from left. Button scales up from 0.9 to 1 with 0.4s delay. Badge fades in from 0 opacity. Atmospheric haze has subtle animated glow/pulse effect (2.5s cycle)
animation.technicalImplementation: GSAP ScrollTrigger with scrub for background parallax, timeline for text stagger sequence, CSS keyframe animation or GSAP for haze pulse effect
animation.propertyChanges: Background - translateY: 0→-30% (relative to scroll progress, scrub: 1.5). Heading - opacity: 0→1, translateX: -50px→0px, duration: 0.8s. Subheading - opacity: 0→1, translateX: -50px→0px, duration: 0.8s, delay: 0.2s. Button - opacity: 0→1, scale: 0.9→1, duration: 0.6s, delay: 0.4s. Badge - opacity: 0→1, duration: 0.5s. Haze - opacity: 0.3→0.6, blur: 20px→30px, 2.5s cycle
animation.codeHint: gsap.to('.mars-background', { yPercent: -30, ease: 'none', scrollTrigger: { trigger: '.cta-section', start: 'top bottom', end: 'bottom top', scrub: 1.5 }}); const tl = gsap.timeline({ scrollTrigger: { trigger: '.cta-section', start: 'top 70%' }}); tl.from('.cta-heading', { opacity: 0, x: -50, duration: 0.8 }).from('.cta-subheading', { opacity: 0, x: -50, duration: 0.8 }, '-=0.6').from('.cta-button', { opacity: 0, scale: 0.9, duration: 0.6 }, '-=0.4').from('.cta-badge', { opacity: 0, duration: 0.5 }, '-=0.3'); gsap.to('.mars-haze', { opacity: 0.6, filter: 'blur(30px)', duration: 2.5, repeat: -1, yoyo: true })

items.question: How is TensorStax different from other pipeline management tools?
Does TensorStax store or access my raw data?
Can TensorStax be deployed in my own cloud?
Is TensorStax compliant with enterprise security standards?
What data platforms does TensorStax support?

animation.subject: Heading + all accordion items stagger
animation.visualDescription: White 'Frequently asked questions' heading top-left, 5 FAQ items stacked below with white plus icons
animation.observedBehavior: Heading fades in first, then accordion items with 0.15s stagger. Plus icons rotate 0deg (hover likely rotates to 45deg for X)
animation.technicalImplementation: GSAP ScrollTrigger with timeline for heading → items sequence
animation.propertyChanges: Heading - opacity: 0→1, y: 30px→0px, duration: 0.7s. Items - stagger: 0.15s after heading. Icons - rotate: 0deg→45deg on click
animation.codeHint: const tl = gsap.timeline({ scrollTrigger: { trigger: '.faq-section', start: 'top 70%' }}); tl.from('.faq-heading', { opacity: 0, y: 30, duration: 0.7 }).from('.faq-item', { opacity: 0, y: 20, stagger: 0.15, duration: 0.6 }, '-=0.3')

animation.subject: Footer section fade-in
animation.visualDescription: Bright orange footer with black text/elements, newsletter form on left, navigation links on right, social icons top-right, logo and legal links at bottom
animation.observedBehavior: Footer fades in as whole section. Form elements appear with slight delay (0.2s). Nav links stagger from top to bottom (0.1s each). Social icons fade in together
animation.technicalImplementation: GSAP ScrollTrigger for section, timeline for element sequence
animation.propertyChanges: Section - opacity: 0→1, duration: 0.6s. Form - delay: 0.2s. Nav links - stagger: 0.1s. Social icons - delay: 0.4s
animation.codeHint: const tl = gsap.timeline({ scrollTrigger: { trigger: 'footer', start: 'top 80%' }}); tl.from('footer', { opacity: 0, duration: 0.6 }).from('.newsletter-form', { opacity: 0, x: -20, duration: 0.5 }, '-=0.4').from('.footer-nav a', { opacity: 0, y: 10, stagger: 0.1, duration: 0.4 }, '-=0.3').from('.social-icons a', { opacity: 0, scale: 0.8, stagger: 0.05, duration: 0.3 }, '-=0.2')
